contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox locomotive | name=GE U25C | powertype=[[Diesel-electric]] | image=BN U25C 5603.jpg | imagesize=250px | caption=[[Burlington Northern Railroad]] U25C #5603. | gauge={{RailGauge|ussg}} | builder=[[GE Transportation Systems]] | buildmodel=U25C | aarwheels=C-C | locale=[[United States]] | primemover=[[GE FDL-16]] | poweroutput={{convert|2500|hp|kW|sigfig=3|abbr=on|lk=on}} | builddate=September 1963 – December 1965 | totalproduction=113 }} The '''U25C''' was [[GE Transportation Systems|General Electric]]'s first six-axle [[road switcher]] intended for the [[United States]] domestic market. Launched in September 1963, it remained in production until December 1965. It was replaced by the [[GE U28C|U28C]]. ==External links== * Sarberenyi, Robert. ''[http://www.trainweb.org/jaydeet/u25c.htm U25C Original Owners]'' == Original Buyers == <br> {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center ! Owner !! Quantity !! Numbers !! Notes |- |[[Atlantic Coast Line Railroad]] || 21 || 3000–3020 || align=left| to [[Seaboard Coast Line Railroad]] 2100–2120; 19 to [[Ferrocarriles Nacionales de México]] |- |[[Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad]] || 12 || 550–561 || align=left| to [[Burlington Northern]] 5630–5641 |- |[[Lake Superior and Ishpeming Railroad]] || 2 || 2500–2501 || align=left| |- |[[Louisville and Nashville Railroad]] || 18 || 1500–1517 || align=left| 1518–1525 ex Oro Dam |- |[[Northern Pacific Railway]] || 30 || 2500–2529 || align=left| to Burlington Northern 5600–5629 |- |[[Oro Dam Project]], California || 10 || 8010–8019 || align=left| 8 later to Louisville and Nashville Railroad 1518–1525, other 2 wrecked |- align = "center" |[[Pennsylvania Railroad]] || 20 || 6500–6519 || align=left| to [[Penn Central]] 6500–6519; to [[Conrail]] 6500–6519; renumbered 6800–6819 |- |} ==References== * {{Marre-diesel-50}} {{GE diesels}} [[Category:General Electric locomotives|U25C]] [[Category:C-C locomotives]] [[Category:Diesel locomotives of the United States]] [[Category:Railway locomotives introduced in 1963]] {{diesel-loco-stub}}
